intro: Tylophora erubescens, commonly known as the red-flowered tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in dense forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
